author: Swati Gupta, Ruchi Bhatia
description: India’s growth depends on building factories without losing the workers powering its gig boom.
title: Modi’s Make in India Ambitions Clash With a Surging Gig Economy

author: Brian Platt, Thomas Seal
description: The Canadian government will accelerate the development of mining and energy projects so that companies are better able to compete in markets worldwide, said the official in charge of shepherding new proposals through to construction.
title: Carney’s Projects Czar Pledges to Help Firms Compete Globally

author: Maggie Eastland
description: Morgan Stanley is facing scrutiny from the Republican head of the US House China committee over whether the bank performed enough due diligence in underwriting the $3.7 billion Hong Kong initial public offering of Zijin Gold International Co. in September.
title: Morgan Stanley Queried by Congressman on Gold Miner’s HK IPO

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Republicans won shutdown fight but Democrats have an issue to campaign on.
title: Health Care Costs Now Gets a Central Role in Midterm Campaign

author: Catherine Lucey
description: The US and Argentina reached a deal to deepen “bilateral trade and investment cooperation,” the White House said Thursday in a notice briefly posted to its government website.
title: US, Argentina Reach Deal to Open Markets on Key Goods

author: Ben Otto, Chandra Asmara
description: The first sign of trouble surfaced thousands of miles from Indonesia.
title: How the US Ended Up With Radioactive Shrimp and Sneakers From Indonesia

author: Vincent Lee
description: The British Broadcasting Corp. issued a formal apology to Donald Trump on Thursday over the misleading edit of the US president’s speech in a documentary program aired late last year, but rejected his demands for compensation.
title: BBC Apologizes to Trump, But Says No Basis for Defamation Claim

author: Anna Edgerton
description: Katie Wilson, a community organizer who campaigned on raising taxes on the wealthy to expand social services, won election as Seattle’s next mayor as she edged out incumbent Bruce Harrell after a tight race.
title: Seattle Progressive Ousts Moderate Mayor After Nailbiter Race

author: Annika Inampudi, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump welcomed Wall Street’s top brass for dinner at the White House on Wednesday, conferring with some of the country’s biggest financial players as the administration leans into an effort to address affordability concerns.
title: Wall Street Chiefs Dine at White House as Trump Courts Industry

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The US Justice Department moved to join a legal challenge to California’s Democratic-leaning congressional districts that were approved by the state’s voters last week, raising the stakes in an ongoing fight over the new maps.
title: Trump’s DOJ Seeks to Block California’s New Congressional Maps

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to expand foster care services to children moving out of the system into adulthood, bolstering one of first lady Melania Trump’s initiatives.
title: Trump Signs Order Championed by First Lady to Boost Foster Care

author: Fabienne Kinzelmann, Bastian Benrath-Wright, Hugo Miller, Skylar Woodhouse
description: US President Donald Trump is expected to attend the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos next year, according to people familiar with his planning, signaling warming US-Swiss relations as the nations close in on a trade deal.
title: Trump Plans to Attend Davos Next Year in Boost to Switzerland

author: Iain Marlow
description: The US designated certain foreign affiliates of the left-wing Antifa movement as global terrorists in a move that expands a crackdown on the loose collective of anti-fascist organizations the Trump administration has accused of spreading violence.
title: US Labels Several Foreign Antifa Groups as Terrorists

author: Myles Miller
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem announced $10,000 bonus checks for Transportation Security Administration officers who worked without pay during the six-week government shutdown, calling the payments a reward for “exemplary service” under strain.
title: TSA Officers Get $10,000 Bonuses After Working Through Shutdown

description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — The Justice Department on Thursday sued to block new congressional district boundaries approved by California voters last week, joining a court battle that could help determine which party wins control of the U.S. House in 2026.
title: Justice Department Sues to Block New California US House Map, AP Reports

author: Andreina Itriago, Patricia Laya
description: Venezuela is rounding up dissidents and urging citizens to spy on their neighbors as the approach of a US aircraft carrier strike group puts the country on edge.
title: Venezuelans Urged to Spy on Their Neighbors as US Warship Nears

author: Manuela Tobias, James Attwood, Jonathan Gilbert
description: Argentine President Javier Milei is planning to modify regulations that protect Andean glaciers in order to unlock tens of billions of dollars of mining investments, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Milei Seeks to Accelerate Argentina’s Copper Boom by Easing Glacier Rules

author: Alex Wickham
description: Recent intelligence assessments show Vladimir Putin has no intention of reaching a peace deal with Ukraine, Britain’s former spy chief said, confirming a view underpinning a harder line from the US and its allies.
title: Intel Shows Putin Not Ready for Ukraine Deal, Ex-MI6 Chief Says

author: Rachel Adams-Heard
description: New Mexico’s senior US senator is demanding that Immigration and Customs Enforcement immediately transfer people out of a privately run detention facility whose contract expired last month.
title: Senator Calls for Evacuation of ICE Site After Contract Lapse

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The Trump administration and Mexico targeted gambling establishments with alleged financial links to Latin American drug cartels on Thursday, with the US sanctioning several individuals and 10 casinos.
title: US Sanctions Drug Cartel-Linked Casinos, Individuals in Mexico

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, David Hellier
description: Joe Lewis, the UK billionaire and former owner of Tottenham Hotspur Football Club, received a pardon from President Donald Trump over his conviction in the US for insider trading.
title: Trump Pardons UK Billionaire Joe Lewis Over Insider Trading

author: Chris Strohm, Jimmy Jenkins
description: Lawyers for former FBI Director James Comey and New York Attorney General Letitia James on Thursday sparred with the government in court over whether a federal prosecutor who brought charges against them was lawfully appointed to her position.
title: Trump Foes Comey, James Dispute Prosecutor’s Authority in Court

author: Will Standring
description: UK Health Secretary Wes Streeting is now the favorite to be the next prime minister after the Labour Party descended into infighting over allegations of a planned leadership coup against Prime Minister Keir Starmer, according to Betfair Exchange.
title: Streeting Tops Farage as Favorite for Next UK Premier, Odds Show

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canadians have little faith a trade deal with the US will be reached in the next six months, after US President Donald Trump blew up talks over an anti-tariff ad campaign launched by the province of Ontario.
title: Most Canadians Say US Trade Deal Unlikely in Next Six Months

author: Fabiano Maisonnave, Jennifer A Dlouhy, John Ainger
description: A top UN climate official demanded Brazilian authorities immediately develop a plan for addressing security lapses, soaring temperatures, flooding and other poor conditions at the COP30 conference in the city of Belém.
title: UN Orders Brazil to Improve Security, Poor Conditions at COP30

author: Alex Wickham
description: Richard Moore, who recently stepped down as head of Britain’s foreign intelligence service MI6, said the UK government should be able to find a solution that would let it approve China’s request for a new embassy in London.
title: Ex-MI6 Chief Says Chinese Should ‘Get Their Embassy’ in London

author: Laura Nahmias, Leah Nylen
description: Former Federal Trade Commission Chair Lina Khan said she’s exploring ways to maximize New York City mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani’s executive authority through little-used laws already in place.
title: Lina Khan Wants to Amplify Mamdani’s Power With Little-Used Laws

author: Shona Ghosh
description: A misleading edit in a BBC documentary has become the target of a $1 billion lawsuit threat from US President Donald Trump and triggered the resignation of the British public broadcaster’s director-general, Tim Davie.
title: How a BBC Documentary Triggered a $1 Billion Lawsuit Threat from President Trump

author: Paulina Cachero
description: Manhattan rent prices ticked higher in the month before Zohran Mamdani won New York City’s mayoral election on promises to improve affordability.
title: Manhattan Rent Prices Climbed Near Record in Month Before Mamdani Win

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Pressured by voters and the US, Gustavo Petro is desperate to show progress in his quest for ‘Total Peace’
title: Cocaine Bonanza and a Defiant Colombian President Infuriate Trump

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Presionado por los votantes y EE.UU., Gustavo Petro está desesperado por mostrar avances en su búsqueda de la “paz total”.
title: Petro va contrarreloj en Colombia para mostrar resultados con su "Paz Total"

author: Dan Strumpf
description: Indian leaders have been careful in their response to the attack.
title: Modi Has a Dilemma Over New Delhi Terror Blast

author: Michael Nienaber
description: With concern rising around the threat posed by an increasingly hostile Russia, Germany is rolling out incentives to lure new army recruits while stopping short of making military service mandatory.
title: Germany Won’t Make Military Service Mandatory (Unless It Has To)

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: Republicans, still celebrating their US government shutdown victory, are waking up to a health-care hangover that risks upending the balance of power in President Donald Trump’s Washington.
title: GOP’s Shutdown Win May Backfire Over Soaring Health-Care Costs

author: Alastair Reed, Rodney Jefferson
description: Scotland plans to issue its first bonds within the next two years as the pro-independence government in Edinburgh seeks to demonstrate greater financial sovereignty and gain access to a new pool of investors.
title: Scotland Plans to Sell Its First Ever Government Bonds

author: Colum Murphy, Jing Li
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will not join the Group of 20 summit later this month, a move that will be a blow to host South Africa that’s already facing a boycott from US President Donald Trump.
title: Xi Joins Trump in Skipping G-20 Summit in Blow to South Africa

author: Oliver Crook, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy promised to support a full investigation into a widening corruption scandal that’s engulfing the country’s ruling elite, including his former business partner.
title: Zelenskiy Vows Justice in Ukraine Corruption Probe Tied to Ex-Partner

author: Alex Wickham
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer has apologized to Health Secretary Wes Streeting, as the British premier tried to contain the fallout from allegations by his allies of cabinet plots against his leadership.
title: Starmer Apologizes for Plot Allegations Against UK Health Chief

author: Oliver Crook, Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy implored European Union allies to overcome their divisions on the use of frozen Russian assets, saying fresh funding is critical for his war-battered economy to stay in the fight against Moscow.
title: Zelenskiy Says Ukraine’s Survival Rests on New Funds From Allies

author: Karl Lester M Yap
description: Indonesia is close to a wipeout of this year’s government bond market inflows as global funds rush for the exit.
title: Indonesia Close to Having Zero Foreign Bond Inflow This Year

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan President Salva Kiir dismissed Vice President Benjamin Bol Mel, who had been seen as a potential future leader of the oil-producing nation.
title: South Sudan President Fires Deputy Seen as Potential Successor

author: Preeti Soni
description: India approved changes to royalty rates for several critical minerals, as part of efforts to boost domestic mining and reduce the nation’s heavy reliance on imports.
title: India Revamps Critical Mineral Royalties to Boost Local Mining

author: Michael Heath, Philip Heijmans
description: Australia signaled lingering unease Thursday over whether Russia may seek access to an air base in eastern Indonesia, stressing that Jakarta has an obligation to consult Canberra on matters affecting regional security.
title: Australia Urges Indonesia to Consult Amid Russian Base Concerns

author: Harry Wilson
description: A former US Treasury secretary and a top Wall Street lawyer each exchanged emails with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein that criticized President Donald Trump, according to documents released by House Democrats on Wednesday.
title: Larry Summers, Goldman Lawyer Slammed Trump in Epstein Emails

author: Erik Wasson, Alicia Diaz, Jarrell Dillard
description: A six-week clash between President Donald Trump and congressional Democrats that disrupted flights across the country and delayed food aid for millions is set to end within hours after the House passed a temporary funding bill.
title: House Passes Spending Bill to End Record US Government Shutdown

author: Anna Edgerton
description: Katie Wilson, a community organizer who campaigned on raising taxes on the wealthy to expand social services, is poised to become Seattle’s next mayor as the latest returns expanded her lead over incumbent Bruce Harrell.
title: Progressive Candidate Wilson Poised to Become Next Seattle Mayor

author: Ben Westcott
description: Victoria has made history as the first Australian state to strike a treaty with its Indigenous peoples — a landmark step in a nation still reckoning with its colonial past.
title: First Australia Treaty With Indigenous People Signed in Victoria

author: Irina Anghel
description: UK property surveyors painted a picture of a housing market cooling rapidly in the run-up to Labour’s November budget as fears of tax rises weigh on buyers and sellers alike.
title: Budget Fears Slam Brakes on UK Housing Market, Agents Warn
